pr_title: Add check for empty list delete

timeline.message: add check for empty list to delete

timeline.body: Is `false` the most appropriate return value here? Although this is a special case, we have that 0 files have been deleted out of 0 requested (unless the return value is also an indication that a `delete` operation did actually take place).
timeline.bodyText: Is false the most appropriate return value here? Although this is a special case, we have that 0 files have been deleted out of 0 requested (unless the return value is also an indication that a delete operation did actually take place).
timeline.bodyHTML: Is false the most appropriate return value here? Although this is a special case, we have that 0 files have been deleted out of 0 requested (unless the return value is also an indication that a delete operation did actually take place).
timeline.author: nvitucci

replies.bodyText: Hmm, I'm not actually sure, I couldn't find the result of this method used anywhere
replies.author: andreeapad

replies.bodyText: Same here, the only call I have found for this method discards the return value. @patduin, what do you think?
replies.author: nvitucci

replies.bodyText:
I think it's ok, false is what io.File.delete() does.
Unfortunately this class does not have a test, luckily that will soon be fixed right @andreeapad ?!? :)
replies.author: patduin

timeline.body: This may be slightly pedantic, but this test is testing that calling `delete` on `s3://empty-bucket` does what is expected.  The situation of the error is just slightly different - calling `delete` on `s3://bucket/empty-folder/`, where `empty-folder` has no sub-keys.  Maybe we should add a test for this (or change this test)?
timeline.bodyText: This may be slightly pedantic, but this test is testing that calling delete on s3://empty-bucket does what is expected.  The situation of the error is just slightly different - calling delete on s3://bucket/empty-folder/, where empty-folder has no sub-keys.  Maybe we should add a test for this (or change this test)?
timeline.bodyHTML: This may be slightly pedantic, but this test is testing that calling delete on s3://empty-bucket does what is expected. The situation of the error is just slightly different - calling delete on s3://bucket/empty-folder/, where empty-folder has no sub-keys. Maybe we should add a test for this (or change this test)?

timeline.author: massdosage

timeline.body: Method says "succeeds" but assertion is on method returning `false`. Is the behaviour here that it will return false as it can't actually delete a bucket?
timeline.bodyText: Method says "succeeds" but assertion is on method returning false. Is the behaviour here that it will return false as it can't actually delete a bucket?
timeline.bodyHTML: Method says "succeeds" but assertion is on method returning false. Is the behaviour here that it will return false as it can't actually delete a bucket?
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: oops, it should be fails in this case, I have to modify the test to make it succeed actually
replies.author: andreeapad

timeline.body: I think this is actually non-existent bucket not empty right? As we don't create it anywhere.
timeline.bodyText: I think this is actually non-existent bucket not empty right? As we don't create it anywhere.
timeline.bodyHTML: I think this is actually non-existent bucket not empty right? As we don't create it anywhere.
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: We create it in the last test. If we try to delete a non-existent bucket, we get an AmazonS3Exception. Should I add a test for that as well?
replies.author: andreeapad

replies.bodyText: Ah you're right, sorry,  I missed that. Might as well add a test for a non-existent bucket, it's an edge case we should never run into but to be thorough would be good to test it.
replies.author: massdosage

timeline.body: If this throws an exception you don't need to store the result or assert on it as that code will never execute.
timeline.bodyText: If this throws an exception you don't need to store the result or assert on it as that code will never execute.
timeline.bodyHTML: If this throws an exception you don't need to store the result or assert on it as that code will never execute.
